contraindications.rationale: Metformin is renally cleared. Impaired renal function increases lactic acidosis risk
contraindications.management: Contraindicated if eGFR <30, use caution 30-45, monitor renal function
contraindications.source: FDA Black Box Warning, ADA Guidelines

contraindications.rationale: NSAIDs cause fluid retention and worsen heart failure, increase hospitalization risk
contraindications.management: Avoid NSAIDs, use acetaminophen or topical alternatives

contraindications.rationale: High-dose aspirin may worsen renal function via prostaglandin inhibition
contraindications.management: Use low-dose aspirin cautiously, avoid high doses

contraindications.rationale: ACE inhibitors may cause hyperkalemia and acute renal decline in CKD
contraindications.management: Dose reduction required, monitor K+ and creatinine closely

contraindications.rationale: Warfarin is INDICATED for stroke prevention in AF (this is NOT a contraindication)
Statins slightly increase diabetes risk but benefits outweigh risks in CVD prevention
contraindications.management: Monitor glucose, but do not withhold statin

metadata.note: Includes both true contraindications and clinically important drug-condition interactions
